intro: Stoebe pentheri, commonly known as the purple mountain betony, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Stoebe pentheri is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
